TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract UserPermissionObject implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.UserPermission

Docs.summary: Represents a member of the current form's collection.

remarks.para: This type is a wrapper for a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. Use this type to access the members of the COM interface implemented by this coclass. For information about the COM interface, including a link to descriptions of its members, see.
The UserPermissionObject object associates a set of permissions for the current form with a single user and an optional expiration date.

Define a user and the permissions associated with that user with the properties of the UserPermission class, and then use the method of the object to add and grant that user permissions on the current form. Use the method of the UserPermission object to remove a user and the user's permissions.

While some permissions granted through the user interface apply to all users, such as printing and expiration date, you can use the UserPermission object to assign them on a per-user basis with per-user expiration dates.
